This cannot be processed by DVDShrink as the copy protection was not removed completely.
So, unless you have been successful with dual layer DVDs, you cannot burn this to DVD.

I now have this on a 4.7Gb disk. Here's how.
First, if you do not have AnyDVD installed, download and install it.

Next get hold of FixVTS from the web (free).

Now, using Nero, burn onto a DVD-RW as much of the Pirates file system as possible. It is ESSENTIAL that VTS_01_1.VOB is one of the files you burn to disk.

Now, using Windows COPY/PASTE, copy VTS_01_1 from the disk back to your HDD.
It is essential that AnyDVD is running during this copy step.
If you have VLC player installed you can check your success this far by using it to play the VTS_01_1 file you have just put on your HDD. You may have to select an audio stream to get sound.
Next COPY/PASTE your new VTS_01_1 file back into the original file structure replacing the original.
If you like you can now verify that the file structure still plays correctly at this time.

The final step is to run FixVTS against the file system starting with VTS_01_1. It will process all the VTS files from 1 - 8. This will take a while so go make coffee or open a beer.

Once complete, you can now open the file structure with DVD Shrink and process as usual.
Good luck.
